Class NycPizzaController

java.lang.Object
com.example.rupizza.NycPizzaController
public class NycPizzaController extends Object
The `NycPizzaController` handles the UI for ordering New York-style pizzas in the RuPizzeria app. It allows users to select pizza type, customize toppings, choose size, and manage the order. The controller interacts with UI elements and updates the price based on user selections.
Author:
Raashi Maheshwari, Tanvi Yamarthy

    • NycPizzaController

      public NycPizzaController()

  • Method Details

    • setOrder

      public void setOrder(Order order)
      Sets the current order to be used in this controller.
      Parameters:
      order - The order to associate with this pizza controller.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller. Sets up listeners for UI components such as buttons, radio buttons, and choice boxes, as well as populating the toppings list.

    • backToMain

      private void backToMain()
      Handles navigating back to the main menu when the back button is clicked.

    • loadPizzaToppings

      private void loadPizzaToppings()
      Loads the selected pizza's toppings into the selected toppings list.

    • updatePizzaSelection

      private void updatePizzaSelection(String pizzaType)
      Updates the pizza selection based on the selected pizza type. Also updates the crust type and topping list.
      Parameters:
      pizzaType - The type of pizza selected from the dropdown.

    • addTopping

      private void addTopping()
      Adds the selected topping from the available toppings list to the selected toppings list. Only allows adding toppings if the pizza is a "Build Your Own" pizza.

    • displayImage

      private void displayImage(String pizzaType)
      Displays the image of the selected pizza type.
      Parameters:
      pizzaType - The pizza type used to determine the image path.

    • removeTopping

      private void removeTopping()
      Removes the selected topping from the selected toppings list and adds it back to the available toppings list. Only allows removing toppings if the pizza is a "Build Your Own" pizza.

    • addPizzaToOrder

      private void addPizzaToOrder()
      Adds the current pizza to the order if the pizza type and size are selected. Displays a success or error message accordingly.

    • resetFields

      private void resetFields()
      Resets all input fields and selections to their initial state. Clears the pizza type, selected toppings, available toppings, crust text, price text, and the pizza image view. Also resets the size radio buttons and disables the add/remove topping buttons.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String message)
      Displays an informational alert with a given title and message. This method is used to show alerts to the user for informational purposes (e.g., errors, warnings).
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the alert window.
      message - The content/message to display in the alert.

    • showSuccess

      private void showSuccess(String title, String message)
      Displays a success alert with a given title and message. This method shows a success message with a green background to indicate successful actions.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the success alert window.
      message - The content/message to display in the success alert.

    • updatePrice

      private void updatePrice()
      Updates the price of the current pizza based on the selected size and toppings. The price is calculated based on the pizza size (small, medium, large) and the pizza's toppings. The updated price is displayed in the priceText field.
